OPTION.NAME: --board-options
OPTION.DESC: string List of board options separated by commas. Or can be used multiple times for multiple options.

OPTION.NAME: --build-cache-path
OPTION.DESC: string Builds of 'core.a' are saved into this path to be cached and reused.

OPTION.NAME: --build-path
OPTION.DESC: string Path where to save compiled files. If omitted, a directory will be created in the default temporary path of your OS.

OPTION.NAME: --build-property
OPTION.DESC: string Override a build property with a custom value. Can be used multiple times for multiple properties.

OPTION.NAME: --clean
OPTION.DESC: Optional, cleanup the build folder and do not use any cached build.

OPTION.NAME: --discovery-timeout
OPTION.DESC: duration Max time to wait for port discovery, e.g.: 30s, 1m (default 1s)

OPTION.NAME: --dump-profile
OPTION.DESC: Create and print a profile configuration from the build.

OPTION.NAME: --encrypt-key
OPTION.DESC: string The name of the custom encryption key to use to encrypt a binary during the compile process. Used only by the platforms that support it.

OPTION.NAME: --export-binaries
OPTION.DESC: If set built binaries will be exported to the sketch folder.

OPTION.NAME: --fqbn
OPTION.DESC: string Fully Qualified Board Name, e.g.: arduino:avr:uno

OPTION.NAME: --help
OPTION.DESC: help for compile

OPTION.NAME: --keys-keychain
OPTION.DESC: string The path of the dir to search for the custom keys to sign and encrypt a binary. Used only by the platforms that support it.

OPTION.NAME: --libraries
OPTION.DESC: string Path to a collection of libraries. Can be used multiple times or entries can be comma separated.

OPTION.NAME: --library
OPTION.DESC: string Path to a single library’s root folder. Can be used multiple times or entries can be comma separated.

OPTION.NAME: --only-compilation-database
OPTION.DESC: Just produce the compilation database, without actually compiling. All build commands are skipped except pre* hooks.

OPTION.NAME: --optimize-for-debug
OPTION.DESC: Optional, optimize compile output for debugging, rather than for release.

OPTION.NAME: --output-dir
OPTION.DESC: string Save build artifacts in this directory.

OPTION.NAME: --port
OPTION.DESC: string Upload port address, e.g.: COM3 or /dev/ttyACM2

OPTION.NAME: --preprocess
OPTION.DESC: Print preprocessed code to stdout instead of compiling.

OPTION.NAME: --profile
OPTION.DESC: string Sketch profile to use

OPTION.NAME: --programmer
OPTION.DESC: string Programmer to use, e.g: atmel_ice

OPTION.NAME: --protocol
OPTION.DESC: string Upload port protocol, e.g: serial

OPTION.NAME: --quiet
OPTION.DESC: Optional, suppresses almost every output.

OPTION.NAME: --show-properties
OPTION.DESC: string[="unexpanded"] Show build properties instead of compiling. The properties are returned exactly as they are defined. Use "--show-properties=expanded" to replace placeholders with compilation context values. (default "disabled")

OPTION.NAME: --sign-key
OPTION.DESC: The name of the custom signing key to use to sign a binary during the compile process. Used only by the platforms that support it.

OPTION.NAME: --upload
OPTION.DESC: Upload the binary after the compilation.

OPTION.NAME: --verify
OPTION.DESC: Verify uploaded binary after the upload.

OPTION.NAME: --vid-pid
OPTION.DESC: When specified, VID/PID specific build properties are used, if board supports them.

OPTION.NAME: --warnings
OPTION.DESC: string Optional, can be: none, default, more, all. Used to tell gcc which warning level to use (-W flag). (default "none")

OPTION.NAME: --additional-urls
OPTION.DESC: strings Comma-separated list of additional URLs for the Boards Manager.

OPTION.NAME: --config-file
OPTION.DESC: string The custom config file (if not specified the default will be used).

OPTION.NAME: --format
OPTION.DESC: string The output format for the logs, can be: text, json, jsonmini, yaml (default "text")

OPTION.NAME: --log-file
OPTION.DESC: string Path to the file where logs will be written.

OPTION.NAME: --log-format
OPTION.DESC: string The output format for the logs, can be: text, json

OPTION.NAME: --log-level
OPTION.DESC: string Messages with this level and above will be logged. Valid levels are: trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, panic

OPTION.NAME: --no-color
OPTION.DESC: Disable colored output.

OPTION.NAME: --verbose
OPTION.DESC: Print the logs on the standard output.
